response_parsed.title: Harden REST APIs Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides a comprehensive guide on how to secure and harden REST APIs using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding FastAPI and its features for building secure APIs
Implementing Authentication and Authorization with FastAPI
Utilizing OpenAPI specification for API documentation and contract testing
Incorporating Security Best Practices like Input Validation, Rate Limiting, and Content Security Policy
Leveraging FastAPI's built-in protection against common web vulnerabilities

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
app = FastAPI()

# Sample of authentication using OAuth2 Password Bearer scheme
security = [Depends(oauth2_scheme)]

@app.get('/protected', security=security)
def protected(): ...

from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException
from pydantic import BaseModel

class Item(BaseModel):
    name: str
    description: str

app = FastAPI()

# Input validation example
@app.post('/items/')
def create_item(item: Item): ...

version_notes: This guide is specifically for Python 3.12+ and FastAPI 0.71.0 or later
Make sure to keep your FastAPI version up-to-date with the latest security patches
caveats: Always validate input data from clients before trusting it
Ensure that your APIs are not susceptible to common web vulnerabilities such as SQL Injection, Cross Site Scripting (XSS), and Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
Never share sensitive information like API keys or secrets in client-side code
